meanings.sent1: Eish! I can't believe I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent3: Eish, I missed the bus again!
meanings.sent4: Eish, the news was a real shocker!
meanings.sent5: Eish! The sudden rain ruined our picnic plans.

meanings.definition: Used to show agreement or understanding.
meanings.sent1: Oh, eish, I totally get what you mean.
meanings.sent2: Eish, I agree with you on that.
meanings.sent3: Eish, I see where you're coming from now.
meanings.sent4: Eish, your point is crystal clear.
meanings.sent5: Eish, I'm on the same page as you now.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of emphasis or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: Eish! That movie was so good!
meanings.sent2: Eish, I really enjoyed the concert.
meanings.sent3: Eish, the cake was incredibly delicious!
meanings.sent4: Eish, the view from the top was breathtaking!
meanings.sent5: Eish! The fireworks display was truly spectacular.
